creator: polesz@w00d5t0ck.info
text:
I have an intranet web server, which provides an admin page on
https://192.168.0.1:81/. I accidently wrote http://192.168.0.1:81/, so I got a
400 Bad Request error. Also, apache gave me a hint: https://192.168.0.1/.
Couldn't it be https://192.168.0.1:81/?

If you have "ServerName foo.bar.com:81" set in the SSL vhost it should do
exactly that and does so here, this is probably a configuration error.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
